name: Joab
description: Commander of David's army, son of Zeruiah. Brilliant general who did the dirty work - assassinated Abner, Amasa, and Absalom. Loyal but ruthless, cursed but indispensable.

hidden-dagger.name: Hidden Dagger
hidden-dagger.description: Greeting with one hand, dagger concealed in other
hidden-dagger.prompt: ancient Israelite general in greeting pose - one hand extended in friendship, other hand concealing dagger behind back or in belt, warm smile that doesn't reach calculating eyes, the assassin's welcome

executing-strike.name: The Strike
executing-strike.description: Mid-assassination, doing the dirty work David couldn't
executing-strike.expression: cold efficiency, doing what must be done
executing-strike.prompt: ancient Israelite general mid-strike with weapon - face showing cold efficiency not rage, military precision in the killing blow, doing the dirty work that kings can't be seen doing, necessary evil

defying-david.name: Defying Orders
defying-david.description: Standing over Absalom's body, unapologetic for disobeying
defying-david.expression: defiant loyalty, knowing better than the king
defying-david.prompt: ancient Israelite general standing over fallen prince - three javelins in hand or nearby, face showing defiant certainty that he was right, unapologetic for disobeying king's order to spare Absalom, doing what had to be done

commanding-army.name: Commanding Forces
commanding-army.description: Leading David's army, brilliant tactical mind
commanding-army.prompt: ancient Israelite general on elevated position commanding troops - arm raised directing forces, face showing tactical brilliance, warrior's armor and bearing, the general who never lost, indispensable despite his crimes

grasping-altar.name: Grasping Altar Horns
grasping-altar.description: Final stand - hands on altar horns, defiant to the end
grasping-altar.prompt: ancient Israelite general grasping horns of altar - hands gripping sanctuary's horns for protection, face showing defiant refusal to beg or flee, 'No, I will die here', the warrior's last stand, dignity in doom

sword-never-departs.name: Blood on His Hands
sword-never-departs.description: The weight of all the blood - cursed but unrepentant
sword-never-departs.prompt: ancient Israelite general looking at his own hands - sword at side, expression showing awareness of all the blood spilled, cursed by David but unapologetic, the price of doing what others wouldn't
